node.text: Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) is showing us her take on a classic gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from her Indian heritage. With curry leaves, mango, and lime juice, this tangy and super refreshing cocktail feels like summer in a glass. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Curry Leaf and Mango G&T

node.text: Al Thompson (@drunkenmixologist) shares his version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. With the combination of bright, citrusy grapefruit and floral lavender, this G&T becomes the perfect rooftop cocktail. Simple. Refreshing. Delicious. #StirCreativity

node.text: Watch as @eatwithchrissy makes a tangy, slightly spicy margarita using @cointreau_us, Scotch bonnet peppers, grapefruit, lime, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita uses Scotch Bonnet peppers to give a satisfying kick.

node.title: Margarita Season: Scotch Bonnet and Grapefruit Margarita

node.text: Watch as @andybaraghani makes a sweet and refreshing margarita using @cointreau_us, muddled pineapple and mint, and lime, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita is quite possibly *the* drink of summer.

node.title: Margarita Season: Crushed Pineapple and Mint Margarita

node.text: Melissa Miranda (@meltronica) shares her version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from the Philippines with a riff on the Gin Pom. With grapefruit, ginger, cardamom bitters, a squeeze of lime, and @bombaysapphireus, this drink will remind you of being on the beach. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Ginger Grapefruit G&T

node.text: Julie Reiner (@mixtressnyc) is showing us how to make her spin on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. Julie grew up in Hawai'i and uses that for her inspiration, with watermelon, lemon, and coconut water for a bright burst of summer. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Watermelon Coconut G&T

node.text:
**Sound On** In honor of Mother’s Day, best-selling author and poet Kwame Alexander (@kwamealexander) asked 12 accomplished writers to reflect on how their lives—and their kitchens—mirror their mothers. Everyone got the same prompt, “I am becoming my mother,” and this community poem is a result. Head to the link in our bio to read more about the authors.
Contributors: @vanggarrett, Lesléa Newman, @engle.margarita, @marjorythw, Richard Michelson, Janet Wong, @georgiaheard1, @amstephens_, Maritza Rivera, Reuben Jackson, Lorna Goodison, @erikalsanchez, Deanna Nikaido, and Kwame Alexander

node.title: Kwame Alexander Reads The Ceremony of Giving

node.text: Watch as @empschultz makes a salty blueberry and ginger Margarita using @cointreau_us, muddled blueberry, ginger simple syrup, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita was inspired by a blueberry, ginger, and orange pie she made last summer.

node.title: Margarita Season: Salty Blueberry & Ginger Margarita

node.text: DeVonn Francis (@tuna__turner) is showing us how to make his unique take on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. DeVonn uses pineapple as a nod to his Caribbean roots, celery to compliment the herbaceous notes in the gin, and bay leaf to tie all the ingredients in his Pineapple Celery G&T.

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Pineapple Celery G&T

node.text: Tiffanie Barriere (@thedrinkingcoach) shows us her own version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireUS. Tiffanie makes a strawberry and black peppercorn syrup for a sweet and spicy G&T.

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Black Pepper G+T

node.text: We challenged Chris Morocco (@moroccochris) to recreate @ciaosamin's ravioli verdi using every sense he has - other than sight. Was he up to the challenge? Watch the full video on YouTube at the link in bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 19, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text: Take advantage of tomato season while you still can with this salad adapted from Connecticut’s Mayflower Inn. It’s a house specialty so special that regulars—like bestselling author Dani Shapiro (@daniwriter) who wrote about it in our September issue—have been known to revolt when it’s not on the menu. Yes, it’s that good. You can’t go wrong with blue cheese, fresh tomatoes, and frizzled shallots. Hit the link in our bio to make this salad tonight. 📷: @isa.zapata 🍴: @curlygirlcooks

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 19, 2021. May be an image of drink.

node.text: Okay, yes, it’s August, but summer isn’t over *yet.* We’ve been keeping our ovens off and hanging out in the shade, and, like everyone, drinking booze out of cans. But the Cool Drinks Economy is inflated with canned beverages in various colors, flavors, and ~vibes~. So our staff came up with a list of our favorite drinks in a can (including some nonalcoholic picks) plus the ideal scenarios to consume them. Click the link in our bio to check them out, track them down, and bring them to whatever summer activities you’re squeezing in before it’s sweater weather again. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @aeswist

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 18, 2021. May be an image of bird and text that says 'HOOTERS WINGS SHRIMP BURGERS'.

node.text: The first time writer Zainab Shah (@theshahreport) visited the States from Pakistan, she was 12, and the destination was Orlando, Florida. There, her family took her to Disney World—and to a restaurant her Abu said has the best chicken wings in the world. “As we turn onto Palm Parkway, I think I see it,” she writes. “It looks like a shaadi ghar, where weddings are held in Lahore—flashy, with thin parallel stripes of orange neon light wrapping around every inch of the building. When we get closer I notice the outline of an owl toward the front of the building. It has a tiny mouth and eyes that are entirely too big for its body. The eyes make up the O’s that spell the restaurant’s name: H-O-O-T-E-R-S.” To find out what happened next, read Zainab’s delightful essay at the link in our bio. 🎨 : @ohareeba

node.text: Dial up the flavor of your summer steaks with chow, a sweet and spicy Trinidadian staple. This skirt steak and grilled pineapple chow recipe by developer Lesley Enston (@lesenston) comes together quickly so you have more time for liming—hanging out (preferably outdoors) with food, drinks, and plenty of laughter. You can substitute another pepper for the traditional Scotch bonnet, but according to Enston if your mouth isn’t burning, it’s just not chow. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @susietheodorou 🥣: @elle_jaime

node.text: In the latest Taking on Takeout, we challenged @chefharoldvillarosa to make his very own egg rolls that could stand toe to toe with the restaurant version. Was he up to the task? Watch the full video on YouTube at the link in our bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 17, 2021. May be an image of chow mein.

node.text: This cold noodle salad features a versatile Sichuan peppercorn dressing that will leave your tongue tingling. Chef Simone Tong (@sisitongtong) of @littletongnyc and @silverapricotnyc in NYC uses a popular Chinese cooking technique to pack big flavor into this dish. Heat the oil just until smoking, then carefully drizzle it over the Sichuan peppercorns, garlic, chile flakes, and scallions to create a deliciously fragrant dressing base. Plus, you can save any extra dressing for marinating smashed cucumbers or dipping dumplings. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rebeccajurkevich

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 17, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text: Fresh summer tomatoes take center stage with these saucy Margherita pizza-inspired beans. This dish by developer Ali Slagle (@itsalislagle) swaps cooked-down sauce for peak-season tomatoes that are cooked just enough to bring out their full flavor. According to Slagle, this is a great way to use up perfectly delicious tomatoes that may be a little too banged up to star in a salad. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rebeccajurkevich

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 16, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text:
In this sweet potato grits recipe, chef Kia Damon (@kiacooks) roasts the sweet potato to add an earthy element and a creamy, custardy texture. This pairs perfectly with fried catfish, shrimp smothered in bacon gravy, mushrooms simmered in red curry, or on its own with a simple pat of butter. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: 
Oriana Koren 🍴: @mrsmochi 🥣: @jjoules

node.text: Tofu is ready to soak up anything you throw at it with the ferocity of a dehydrated marathoner. In this 30-minute recipe, a brief hang in soy sauce, mirin, and sherry vinegar, along with a tangle of peppers and fresh chiles, makes this tofu dish perfect for weeknight dinners. According to test kitchen director Chris Morocco (@moroccochris), seeking out great tofu makes a big difference for the utmost in nutty-sweet taste and superior texture. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @emmafishman🍴: @rebeccajurkevich 🥣: @sophiestrangio

node.text: This one-pan chicken dinner by contributor Grant Melton (@grantmelton) gets two times the flavor from using both the peppers and the pickling liquid from a jar of pepperoncinis. The chicken roasts in the spicy pickling liquid, while the potatoes cook away nestled among the bright, yellow peppers. Once the potatoes are done, just toss them together with crisp, raw vegetables to get warm potato salad vibes. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rebeccajurkevich

For those who didn’t grow up eating Mexican and Tex-Mex cuisine, seeing “Mexican oregano” included in a recipe may raise a question or two. Namely, “What is Mexican oregano?” and “Can I just use any oregano instead?” Contributor Jarrett Melendez (@jamarmel) explains it all at the link in our bio. 📷: @emmafishman
